Franz Liszt

Fünf Klavierstücke, S. 192

1865–1879 · LW A233 · R. 60

[IMSLP]

Total duration: 11' 30"

  • 1. Sehr langsam
  • 2. Lento assai
  • 3. Sehr langsam
  • 4. Andantino
  • 5. Sospiri!

These pieces were written over a number of years for Olga von Meyendorff and were likely not intended to form a cycle.

Recommended editions

  • New Liszt Edition (Editio Musica Budapest) · I/10 · Z. A/B 8459 · Various Cyclical Works II · ed. Imre Mező / Imre Sulyok
  • Associated Board · Twenty-one Short Piano Pieces · ed. Howard Ferguson
  • Editio Musica Budapest · Z. 12707 · ed. Imre Mező / Imre Sulyok / Adrienne Kaczmarczyk [no. 1]

1. Sehr langsam

Liszt’s song for voice and piano Gestorben war ich (S. 308; LW N18/2; R. 588) exists in many versions for solo piano. It is most familiar as the second piece, Seliger Tod, of the Liebesträume (S. 541; LW A103; R. 211), which has a related, simpler version (S. 540a; R. 211). Liszt also prepared an incomplete version as Alternative (no. 7) from the Préludes et Harmonies poétiques et religieuses (S. 171d). Many years later, he prepared a further version as the first of the Fünf Klavierstücke (S. 192; LW A233; R. 60).

Duration: 2' 30"

Difficulty: 2.5

2. Lento assai

Duration: 2' 30"

Difficulty: 2.5

Duration: 2'

Difficulty: 2

4. Andantino

Duration: 1' 30"

5. Sospiri!
